problem: Non-technical users struggle to create professional-grade code specifications (76% of developers use AI, but non-coders are left behind)
Existing no-code platforms create apps directly, not specifications (Bubble, Backendless) - missing the specification layer
AI code tools (Copilot, Bolt) require technical knowledge to prompt effectively
Gap: No framework exists that helps non-technical users articulate WHAT they want to build (specifications) before HOW to build it (code)
customer_segments: Primary: Product Managers without coding background (need to spec features for dev teams)
Secondary: Entrepreneurs/Founders with business ideas but no technical co-founder
Tertiary: Business Analysts who translate business needs to technical specs
Edge: VIBE Agency clients who need specs but lack technical vocabulary
canvas_fields.unique_value_proposition: The first conversational framework that transforms vague ideas into professional specifications through guided dialogue, not code generation
solution: Conversational specification builder (like Claude Skills, but for ANY domain, not just LLM tasks)
Template library for common patterns (web app, mobile app, API, data pipeline, etc.)
Iterative refinement through questions (guided interview approach)
Output: Professional PRD/specification ready for developers OR AI code generators
channels: VIBE Agency website (primary distribution for clients)
Integration with AI code tools (Bolt, Cursor, Replit) as 'spec layer'
revenue_streams: Option 2: B2B licensing to agencies (VIBE Agency bundle)
Option 3: Freemium SaaS (free for individuals, paid for teams)
cost_structure: LLM API costs (if using AI for question generation)
key_metrics: Specification completion rate (% users who finish full spec)
Developer satisfaction (do devs find specs useful?)
Time-to-spec (how fast can non-coders create specs?)
Template usage (which domains/patterns are most popular?)
unfair_advantage: Meta-advantage: Built using our own planning framework (dogfooding)
VIBE Agency battle-tested workflows (real client feedback)
Integration with existing VIBE ecosystem (Agency OS, Planning Framework)
First-mover in 'specification generation' space (vs. code generation)

research_sources: WebSearch: AI code generation frameworks non-technical users (SUCCESS)
WebSearch: AI specification generation PRD tools (FAILED - unavailable)
User context: Meta-requirement (framework to build frameworks)

riskiest_assumptions.assumption: Non-technical users WANT to create specifications (vs. just wanting the app built)
riskiest_assumptions.validation_method: User interviews with 20 PMs/entrepreneurs - ask: 'Would you pay for tool that helps you write better specs?'

riskiest_assumptions.assumption: Specifications from framework are good enough for developers to use
riskiest_assumptions.validation_method: Developer feedback study - give them 10 framework-generated specs, rate quality 1-10

riskiest_assumptions.assumption: Users prefer conversational approach over forms/wizards
riskiest_assumptions.validation_method: A/B test: Conversational UI vs. Form-based UI, measure completion rate

riskiest_assumptions.assumption: Framework is 'robust and dynamic' enough (user requirement - unclear definition)
riskiest_assumptions.validation_method: Define 'robust' and 'dynamic' with user, then prototype and iterate

market_context.ai_code_generation_adoption: 76% of developers use AI coding tools (Stack Overflow 2024)
market_context.code_written_by_ai: 41% of all code, 256 billion lines in 2024
market_context.democratization_trend: AI enables non-technical participation in software development
market_context.gap_identified: Tools focus on CODE generation, not SPECIFICATION generation

specification_tools: None found specifically for AI-augmented spec generation

key_differentiators.not_code_generation: Framework creates SPECIFICATIONS, not code (upstream of code tools)
key_differentiators.conversation_first: Guided dialogue vs. blank canvas or rigid forms
key_differentiators.domain_agnostic: Works for any software type (web, mobile, API, data, ML, etc.)
key_differentiators.refactorable: User requirement - specs should be editable/improvable (vs. static PRDs)

observations: EDGE CASE: Commercial project with vague requirements - triggers hybrid mode
EDGE CASE: Meta/recursive requirement (framework for framework building)
EDGE CASE: WebSearch partial failure - framework needs fallback strategy
User explicitly asked for research: 'interessieren, wenn du das jetzt selber recherchierst'

framework_test_edge_cases: EDGE CASE 1: Recursive/Meta requirements (framework for frameworks) - How does LEAN_CANVAS handle abstraction?
EDGE CASE 2: Commercial + Vague = Hybrid mode not explicitly defined in v1.1
EDGE CASE 3: WebSearch failures - Need fallback strategy in framework
EDGE CASE 4: User is simultaneously the builder AND the customer (dogfooding scenario)
framework_improvements_needed: IMPROVEMENT 1: Define 'Hybrid Mode' - commercial projects with vague requirements should get Full Interview + Auto-Research
IMPROVEMENT 2: Graceful degradation when WebSearch fails - use cached knowledge, mark gaps
IMPROVEMENT 3: Handle meta/abstract requirements - add 'abstraction level' field to project_manifest
IMPROVEMENT 4: Dogfooding scenario - framework should recognize when user is building similar tool
